name: CodeAssassinConfigTransformPicker
friendlyName: Config Picker for CodeAssassin:ConfigTransformer based Configs
description: replaces the App/Web.config with the specific config tranformation picked.
author: WFM IRMA/ICON Team

inputs.name: machineList
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of the machine(s) IP addresses or FQDNs.
For example, dbserver.fabrikam.com, dbserver_int.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the administrator's login of the target machine.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the administrator's password of the target machine.
The best practice is to create a variable in the Build or Release definition, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(adminPassword)'.

inputs.name: installPath
inputs.label: App Install Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folder that the App/web.config and the transformations can be found

inputs.name: configName
inputs.label: App/Web Config Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Application config (or web.config if its a web project) to be replaced

inputs.name: transform
inputs.label: Transformation
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Transformation to replace. This value is only the enviroment/build name; the filename will be calculated. (example : Debug, QA, Test, Release)
